medicineDetails.name: Paracetamol
medicineDetails.use: Relieves pain and reduces fever
warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose
Consult doctor if symptoms persist beyond 3 days
Avoid alcohol while taking this medication

medicineDetails.name: Ibuprofen
medicineDetails.use: Reduces pain, inflammation, and fever
warnings: Take with food to reduce stomach upset
Not recommended for people with stomach ulcers
Avoid prolonged use without medical supervision

medicineDetails.name: Cetirizine
medicineDetails.use: Treats allergy symptoms like sneezing, itching, and runny nose
medicineDetails.timing: Can be taken with or without food
warnings: May cause drowsiness, avoid driving
Consult doctor if symptoms persist
Not recommended for children under 2 years

medicineDetails.name: Omeprazole
medicineDetails.use: Reduces stomach acid, treats heartburn and GERD
warnings: Not for immediate relief of heartburn
Long-term use may affect nutrient absorption
Consult doctor before long-term use

medicineDetails.name: Ambroxol
medicineDetails.use: Loosens phlegm and helps clear airways
warnings: Drink plenty of fluids while taking this medication
Not recommended for people with stomach ulcers

medicineDetails.name: Sumatriptan
medicineDetails.use: Treats migraine headaches
medicineDetails.dose: 50-100mg at onset of migraine, may repeat after 2 hours if needed (max 200mg/day)
medicineDetails.timing: At the first sign of migraine
warnings: Not for preventive use
Do not take more than 2 doses in 24 hours
Not recommended for people with heart conditions

medicineDetails.name: Loratadine
medicineDetails.use: Relieves allergy symptoms such as runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes
medicineDetails.timing: Can be taken with or without food
warnings: Less likely to cause drowsiness than other antihistamines
Consult doctor if symptoms persist

medicineDetails.name: Diclofenac
medicineDetails.use: Reduces pain and inflammation in conditions like arthritis
warnings: Take with food to reduce stomach upset
Not recommended for people with kidney problems
Avoid prolonged use

medicineDetails.name: Metformin
medicineDetails.use: Controls blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes
medicineDetails.dose: 500mg once or twice daily, as prescribed
warnings: Regular blood sugar monitoring required
Do not skip meals
Report any unusual muscle pain to doctor

medicineDetails.name: Amoxicillin
medicineDetails.use: Treats bacterial infections such as pneumonia, bronchitis, and ear infections
medicineDetails.timing: Can be taken with or without food
warnings: Complete the full course even if you feel better
May reduce effectiveness of birth control pills
Inform doctor of any allergic reactions

medicineDetails.name: Salbutamol
medicineDetails.use: Relieves asthma symptoms and bronchospasm
warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose
Seek medical help if symptoms worsen
Rinse mouth after use to prevent thrush

medicineDetails.name: Atorvastatin
medicineDetails.use: Lowers cholesterol and reduces risk of heart disease
warnings: Regular liver function tests recommended
Report any unexplained muscle pain to doctor
Avoid grapefruit while taking this medication

medicineDetails.name: Sertraline
medicineDetails.use: Treats depression, anxiety disorders, and OCD
warnings: Do not stop abruptly
May take 4-6 weeks to show full effect
Inform doctor of any worsening symptoms

medicineDetails.name: Pantoprazole
medicineDetails.use: Reduces stomach acid production and treats GERD
warnings: Not for immediate relief of heartburn
Long-term use may increase fracture risk
Take exactly as prescribed

medicineDetails.name: Clotrimazole
medicineDetails.use: Treats fungal skin infections such as athlete's foot and ringworm
medicineDetails.dose: Apply thin layer to affected area 2-3 times daily
medicineDetails.timing: As directed, after cleaning and drying the area
warnings: Continue treatment for 2 weeks after symptoms disappear
Do not use on broken skin
Avoid tight-fitting clothing

medicineDetails.name: Diazepam
medicineDetails.use: Treats anxiety, muscle spasms, and seizures
warnings: May be habit-forming
Do not stop abruptly
Avoid alcohol while taking this medication

medicineDetails.name: Metoprolol
medicineDetails.use: Treats high blood pressure, angina, and heart rhythm disorders
medicineDetails.dose: 25-100mg once or twice daily, as prescribed
warnings: Do not stop abruptly
Monitor blood pressure regularly
Inform doctor if shortness of breath occurs

medicineDetails.name: Levothyroxine
medicineDetails.use: Replaces thyroid hormone in hypothyroidism
medicineDetails.timing: On empty stomach, 30-60 minutes before breakfast
warnings: Take consistently at same time each day
Regular thyroid function tests needed
Wait at least 4 hours before taking calcium or iron supplements

medicineDetails.name: Warfarin
medicineDetails.use: Prevents blood clots in conditions like atrial fibrillation
warnings: Regular blood tests (INR) required
Maintain consistent vitamin K intake
Carry identification stating you take this medication

medicineDetails.name: Insulin Glargine
medicineDetails.use: Long-acting insulin for diabetes management
medicineDetails.dose: Individualized based on blood sugar levels
medicineDetails.timing: Once daily at the same time
warnings: Rotate injection sites
Monitor blood sugar regularly
Always have a source of sugar available for hypoglycemia
